program_name.name: program_name
program_name.description: The name of the program under which related studies will be grouped, in full text and unabbreviated form, exactly as it will be displayed within the UI.

program_acronym.name: program_acronym
program_acronym.description:
The name of the program under which related studies will be grouped, expressed in the form of the acronym by which it will identified within the UI.
This property is used as the key via which study records can be associated with the appropriate program during data loading, and to identify the correct records during data updates.

program_short_description.name: program_short_description
program_short_description.description: An abbreviated, single sentence description of the program.

program_full_description.name: program_full_description
program_full_description.description: A more detailed, multiple sentence description of the program.

program_external_url.name: program_external_url
program_external_url.description: The external url to which users should be directed in order to learn more about the program.

program_sort_order.name: program_sort_order
program_sort_order.description: An arbitrarily-assigned value used to dictate the order in which programs are displayed within the application's UI.

clinical_study_id.name: clinical_study_id
clinical_study_id.description: Where applicable, the ID for the study/trial as generated by the source database.

clinical_study_designation.name: clinical_study_designation
clinical_study_designation.description:
A unique, human-friendly, alpha-numeric identifier by which the study/trial will be identified within the UI.
This property is used as the key via which child records, e.g. case records, can be associated with the appropriate study during data loading, and to identify the correct records during data updates.

clinical_study_name.name: clinical_study_name
clinical_study_name.description: A succinct, narrative title for the study/trial, exactly as it should be displayed within the application's UI.

clinical_study_description.name: clinical_study_description
clinical_study_description.description: A multiple sentence summary of what the study/trial was intended to determine and how it was conducted.

clinical_study_type.name: clinical_study_type
clinical_study_type.description: An arbitrary designation of the study/trial to indicate its underlying. nature, e.g. Clinical Trial, Transcriptomics, Genomics.

date_of_iacuc_approval.name: date_of_iacuc_approval
date_of_iacuc_approval.description: Where applicable, the date upon which the study/trial was approved by the IACUC.

dates_of_conduct.name: dates_of_conduct
dates_of_conduct.description: An indication of the general time period during which the study/trial was active, e.g. (from) month and year (to) month and year.

accession_id.name: accession_id
accession_id.description: A unique, alpha-numeric identifier, in the format of six digits, which is assigned to the study/trial as of it being on-boarded, and which can be resolved by identifiers.org when prefixed with "icdc:" to create a compact identifier in the format icdc:xxxxxx.

study_disposition.name: study_disposition
study_disposition.description: An arbitrarily-assigned value used to dictate how the study/trial is displayed via the ICDC Production environment, based upon the degree to which the data has been on-boarded and/or whether the data is subject to any temporary embargo which prevents its public release.

site_short_name.name: site_short_name
site_short_name.description: The widely-accepted acronym for the institution at which the patient/subject/donor was enrolled into the study/trial, and then treated under the appropriate veterinary medicine program.

veterinary_medical_center.name: veterinary_medical_center
veterinary_medical_center.description: The full name of the insitution at which the patient/subject/donor was enrolled into the study/trial, and then treated under the appropriate veterinary medicine program, together with the site's city and state.

arm.name: arm
arm.description: Where applicable, the nature of each arm into which the study/trial has been divided. For example, in multiple agent clinical trials, the name of the therapeutic agent used in any given study arm.

arm_description.name: arm_description
arm_description.description: A short description of the study arm.

arm_id.name: arm_id
arm_id.description:
A unique identifier via which study arms can be differentiated from one another across studies/trials.
This property is used as the key via which child records, e.g. cohort records, can be associated with the appropriate study arm during data loading, and to identify the correct records during data updates.

cohort_description.name: cohort_description
cohort_description.description: Where applicable, the nature of each cohort into which the study/trial has been divided, e.g. in studies examining the effects of multiple doses of a therapeutic agent, the name and dose of the therapeutic agent used in any given cohort.

cohort_dose.name: cohort_dose
cohort_dose.description: The intended or protocol dose of the therapeutic agent used in any given cohort.

cohort_id.name: cohort_id
cohort_id.description:
A unique identifier via which cohorts can be differentiated from one another across studies/trials.
This property is used as the key via which cases can be associated with the appropriate cohort during data loading, and to identify the correct records during data updates.

case_id.name: case_id
case_id.description:
The globally unique ID by which any given patient/subject/donor can be unambiguously identified and displayed across studies/trials; specifically the value of patient_id as supplied by the data submitter, prefixed with the appropriate ICDC study code during data alignment and/or transformation.
This property is used as the key via which child records, e.g. sample records, can be associated with the appropriate case during data loading, and to identify the correct records during data updates.

patient_id.name: patient_id
patient_id.description: The preferred ID by which the data submitter uniquely identifies any given patient/subject/donor, at least within a single study/trial, recorded exactly as provided by the data submitter. Once prefixed with the appropriate ICDC study code during data alignment and/or transformation, values of Patient ID become values of Case ID.

patient_first_name.name: patient_first_name
patient_first_name.description: Where available, the given name of the patient/subject/donor.

registration_origin.name: registration_origin
registration_origin.description: The entity with which each registration ID is directly associated, for example, an ICDC study, as denoted by the appropriate study code, or the biobank or tissue repository from which samples for a study/trial participant were acquired, as denoted by the appropriate acronym.

registration_id.name: registration_id
registration_id.description: Any ID used by a data submitter to identify a patient/subject/donor, either locally or globally.

biospecimen_repository_acronym.name: biospecimen_repository_acronym
biospecimen_repository_acronym.description: The name of the biobank or tissue repository from which or to which samples for any given patient/subject/donor were acquired or submitted, expressed in the form of an acronym.

biospecimen_repository_full_name.name: biospecimen_repository_full_name
biospecimen_repository_full_name.description: The name of the biobank or tissue repository from which or to which samples for any given patient/subject/donor were acquired or submitted, expressed in full text form.

canine_individual_id.name: canine_individual_id
canine_individual_id.description: A unique numerical ID, which, based upon the existence of registration-based matches between two or more study-specific cases, is auto-generated by the data loader, and which thereby tethers matching cases to the single underlying multi-study participant.

demographic_id.name: demographic_id
demographic_id.description: A unique identifier of each demographic record, used to identify the correct demographic records during data updates. The value of this property will generally be the same as the value of the case_id property.

breed.name: breed
breed.description: The specific breed of the canine patient/subject/donor, per the list of breeds officially recognized by the American Kennel Club.

additional_breed_detail.name: additional_breed_detail
additional_breed_detail.description: For patients/subjects/donors formally designated as either Mixed Breed or Other, any available detail as to the breeds contributing to the overall mix of breeds or clarification of the nature of the Other breed. Values for this field are therefore not relevant to pure-bred patients/subjects/donors, but for those of mixed breed or other origins, values are definitely preferred wherever available.

patient_age_at_enrollment.name: patient_age_at_enrollment
patient_age_at_enrollment.description: The age of the canine patient/subject/donor as of study/trial enrollment, expressed in standard human years, as opposed to dog years.

patient_age_at_enrollment_original.name: patient_age_at_enrollment
patient_age_at_enrollment_original.description: The age of the canine patient/subject/donor as of study/trial enrollment, expressed in standard human years, as opposed to dog years.

date_of_birth.name: date_of_birth
date_of_birth.description: The date of birth of the canine patient/subject/donor.

sex.name: sex
sex.description: The biological sex of the patient/subject/donor.

weight.name: weight
weight.description: The weight of the patient/subject/donor at the time of study/trial enrollment and/or biospecimens being acquired, at least in the case of studies that are not longitudinal in nature.

weight_original.name: weight
weight_original.description: The weight of the patient/subject/donor at the time of study/trial enrollment and/or biospecimens being acquired, at least in the case of studies that are not longitudinal in nature.

neutered_indicator.name: neutered_indicator
neutered_indicator.description: Indicator as to whether the patient/subject/donor has been either spayed (female subjects) or neutered (male subjects).

cycle_number.name: cycle_number
cycle_number.description: For a patient/subject/donor enrolled in a clinical trial evaluating the effects of therapy administered in multiple cycles, the number of the treatment cycle during which visits occurred such that therapy could be administered and/or clinical observations could be made, with cycles numbered according to their chronological order.

date_of_cycle_start.name: date_of_cycle_start
date_of_cycle_start.description: The date upon which the treament cycle in question began.

date_of_cycle_end.name: date_of_cycle_end
date_of_cycle_end.description: The date upon which the treatent cycle in question ended.

visit_date.name: visit_date
visit_date.description: The date upon which the visit occurred.

visit_number.name: visit_number
visit_number.description: The number of the visit during which therapy was administered and/or clinical observations were made, with visits numbered according to their chronological order.

visit_id.name: visit_id
visit_id.description:
A globally unique identifier of each visit record; specifically the value of case_id concatenated with the value of visit_date, the date upon which the visit occurred.
This property is used as the key via which child records, e.g. physical examination records, can be associated with the appropriate visit, and to identify the correct visit records during data updates.

pi_first_name.name: pi_first_name
pi_first_name.description: The first or given name of each principal investigator of the study/trial.

pi_last_name.name: pi_last_name
pi_last_name.description: The last or family name of each principal investigator of the study/trial.

pi_middle_initial.name: pi_middle_initial
pi_middle_initial.description: Where applicable, the middle initial(s) of each principal investigator of the study/trial.

diagnosis_id.name: diagnosis_id
diagnosis_id.description: A unique identifier of each diagnosis record, used to associate child records, e.g. pathology reports, with the appropriate parent, and to identify the correct diagnosis records during data updates. The value of this property will generally be the same as the value of the case_id property.

disease_term.name: disease_term
disease_term.description: The primary disease condition with which the patient/subject/donor was diagnosed.

primary_disease_site.name: primary_disease_site
primary_disease_site.description: The anatomical location at which the primary disease originated, recorded in relatively general terms at the subject level; the anatomical locations from which tumor samples subject to downstream analysis were acquired is recorded in more detailed terms at the sample level.

stage_of_disease.name: stage_of_disease
stage_of_disease.description: The formal assessment of the extent to which the primary cancer with which the patient/subject/donor was diagnosed has progressed, according to the TNM staging or cancer stage grouping criteria.

date_of_diagnosis.name: date_of_diagnosis
date_of_diagnosis.description: The date upon which the patient/subject/donor was diagnosed with the primary disease in question.

histology_cytopathology.name: histology_cytopathology
histology_cytopathology.description: A narrative summary of the primary observations from the the evaluation of a tumor sample from a patient/subject/donor, in terms of its histology and/or cytopathology.

date_of_histology_confirmation.name: date_of_histology_confirmation
date_of_histology_confirmation.description: The date upon which the results of a histological evaluation of a sample from the patient/subject/donor were confirmed.

histological_grade.name: histological_grade
histological_grade.description: The histological grading of the tumor(s) present in the patient/subject/donor, based upon microscopic evaluation(s), and recorded at the subject level; grading of specific tumor samples subject to downstream analysis is recorded at the sample level.

best_response.name: best_response
best_response.description: Where applicable, an indication as to the best overall response to therapeutic intervention observed within an individual patient/subject/donor.

pathology_report.name: pathology_report
pathology_report.description: An indication as to the existence of any detailed pathology evaluation upon which the primary diagnosis was based, either in the form of a formal, subject-specific pathology report, or as detailed in a study-level supplemental data file.

treatment_data.name: treatment_data
treatment_data.description: An indication as to the existence of any treatment data for the patient/subject/donor, typically in the form of a study-level supplemental data file.

follow_up_data.name: follow_up_data
follow_up_data.description: An indication as to the existence of any follow-up data for the patient/subject/donor, typically in the form of a study-level supplemental data file.

concurrent_disease.name: concurrent_disease
concurrent_disease.description: An indication as to whether the patient/subject/donor suffers from any significant secondary disease condition(s).

concurrent_disease_type.name: concurrent_disease_type
concurrent_disease_type.description: The specifics of any notable secondary disease condition(s) observed within the patient/subject/donor.

enrollment_id.name: enrollment_id
enrollment_id.description: A unique identifier of each enrollment record, used to associate child records, e.g. prior surgery records, with the appropriate parent, and to identify the correct enrollment records during data updates. The value of this property will generally be the same as the value of the case_id property.

date_of_registration.name: date_of_registration
date_of_registration.description: The date upon which the patient/subject/donor was enrolled in the study/trial.

initials.name: initials
initials.description: The initials of the patient/subject/donor based upon the subject's first or given name, and the last or family name of the subject's owner.

date_of_informed_consent.name: date_of_informed_consent
date_of_informed_consent.description: The date upon which the owner of the patient/subject/donor signed an informed consent on behalf of the subject.

site_short_name.name: site_short_name
site_short_name.description: The widely-accepted acronym for the institution at which the patient/subject/donor was enrolled into the study/trial, and then treated under the appropriate veterinary medicine program.

veterinary_medical_center.name: veterinary_medical_center
veterinary_medical_center.description: The full name of the insitution at which the patient/subject/donor was enrolled into the study/trial, and then treated under the appropriate veterinary medicine program, together with the site's city and state.

patient_subgroup.name: patient_subgroup
patient_subgroup.description: A short description as to the reason for the patient/subject/donor being enrolled in any given study/trial arm or cohort, for example, a clinical trial patient having been enrolled in a dose escalation cohort.

prior_steroid_exposure.name: prior_steroid_exposure
prior_steroid_exposure.description: Has the patient ever been on steroids? in form

prior_nsaid_exposure.name: prior_nsaid_exposure
prior_nsaid_exposure.description: Has the patient ever been on NSAIDS? in form

date_of_surgery.name: date_of_surgery
date_of_surgery.description: The date upon which the prior surgery in question occurred.

procedure.name: procedure
procedure.description: The type of procedure performed during the prior surgery in question.

anatomical_site_of_surgery.name: anatomical_site_of_surgery
anatomical_site_of_surgery.description: The anatomical location at which the prior surgery in question occurred.

surgical_finding.name: surgical_finding
surgical_finding.description: A narrative description of any notable observations made during the prior surgery in question.

sample_id.name: sample_id
sample_id.description:
The globally unique ID by which any given sample can be unambiguously identified and displayed across studies/trials; specifically the preferred value of the sample identifier used by the data submitter, prefixed with the appropriate ICDC study code during data transformation.
This property is used as the key via which child records, e.g. file records, can be associated with the appropriate sample during data loading, and to identify the correct records during data updates.

sample_site.name: sample_site
sample_site.description: The specific anatomical location from which any given sample was acquired.
permissible_values: Lung, Caudal Aspect of Left Caudal Lobe

physical_sample_type.name: physical_sample_type
physical_sample_type.description: An indication as to the physical nature of any given sample.

general_sample_pathology.name: general_sample_pathology
general_sample_pathology.description: An indication as to whether a sample represents normal tissue versus representing diseased or tumor tissue.

tumor_sample_origin.name: tumor_sample_origin
tumor_sample_origin.description: An indication as to whether a tumor sample was derived from a primary versus a metastatic tumor.

summarized_sample_type.name: summarized_sample_type
summarized_sample_type.description: A summarized representation of a sample's physical nature, normality, and derivation from a primary versus a metastatic tumor, based upon the combination of values in the three independent properties of physical_sample_type, general_sample_pathology and tumor_sample_origin.

molecular_subtype.name: molecular_subtype
molecular_subtype.description: Where applicable, the molecular subtype of the tumor sample in question, for example, the tumor being basal versus lumnial in nature.

specific_sample_pathology.name: specific_sample_pathology
specific_sample_pathology.description: The specific histology and/or pathology associated with a sample.
permissible_values: Carcinoma With Simple And Complex Components

date_of_sample_collection.name: date_of_sample_collection
date_of_sample_collection.description: The date upon which the sample was acquired from the patient/subject/donor.

sample_chronology.name: sample_chronology
sample_chronology.description: An indication as to when a sample was acquired relative to any therapeutic intervention and/or key disease outcome observations.

necropsy_sample.name: necropsy_sample
necropsy_sample.description: An indication as to whether a sample was acquired as a result of a necropsy examination.

tumor_grade.name: tumor_grade
tumor_grade.description: The grade of the tumor from which the sample was acquired, i.e. the degree of cellular differentiation within the tumor in question, as determined by a pathologist's evaluation.

length_of_tumor.name: length_of_tumor
length_of_tumor.description: The length of the tumor from which a tumor sample was derived, as measured in mm.

length_of_tumor_original.name: length_of_tumor
length_of_tumor_original.description: The length of the tumor from which a tumor sample was derived, as measured in mm.

width_of_tumor.name: width_of_tumor
width_of_tumor.description: The width of the tumor from which a tumor sample was derived, as measured in mm.

width_of_tumor_original.name: width_of_tumor
width_of_tumor_original.description: The width of the tumor from which a tumor sample was derived, as measured in mm.

volume_of_tumor.name: volume_of_tumor
volume_of_tumor.description: The volume of the tumor from which a tumor sample was derived, as measured in cubic centimeters.

volume_of_tumor_original.name: volume_of_tumor
volume_of_tumor_original.description: The volume of the tumor from which a tumor sample was derived, as measured in cubic centimeters.

percentage_tumor.name: percentage_tumor
percentage_tumor.description: The purity of a sample of tumor tissue in terms of the percentage of the sample that is represnted by tumor cells, expressed either as a discrete percentage or as a percentage range.

sample_preservation.name: sample_preservation
sample_preservation.description: The method by which a sample was preserved.

file_name.name: file_name
file_name.description: The name of the file, maintained exactly as provided by the data submitter.

file_type.name: file_type
file_type.description: An indication as to the nature of the file in terms of its content, i.e. what type of information the file contains, as opposed to the file's format.

file_description.name: file_description
file_description.description: An optional description of the file and/or its content, as provided by the data submitter, preferably limited to no more than 60 characters in length.

file_format.name: file_format
file_format.description: The specific format of the file as determined by the data loader.

file_size.name: file_size
file_size.description: The exact size of the file in bytes.

md5sum.name: md5sum
md5sum.description: The 32-character hexadecimal md5 checksum value of the file, used to confirm the integrity of files submitted to the ICDC.

file_status.name: file_status
file_status.description: An enumerated representation of the status of any given file.

uuid.name: uuid
uuid.description: The universally unique alpha-numeric identifier assigned to each file.

file_location.name: file_location
file_location.description: The specific location within the ICDC S3 storage bucket at which the file is stored, expressed in terms of a unique url.

image_collection_name.name: image_collection_name
image_collection_name.description: The name of the image collection exactly as it appears at the location where the collection can be viewed and/or accessed.

image_type_included.name: image_type_included
image_type_included.description: A list of the image types included in the image collection, drawn from a list of acceptable values.

image_collection_url.name: image_collection_url
image_collection_url.description: The external url via which the image collection can be viewed and/or accessed.

repository_name.name: repository_name
repository_name.description: The name of the image repository within which the image collection can be found, stated in the form of the appropriate acronym.

collection_access.name: collection_access
collection_access.description: Indicator as to whether the image collection can be accessed via download versus being accessible only via the cloud.

date_of_examination.name: date_of_examination
date_of_examination.description: The date upon which the physical examination in question was conducted.

day_in_cycle.name: day_in_cycle
day_in_cycle.description: Numerically, the day in the treatment cycle upon which any given adverse event was first observed, where Day 1 is the first day of the treatment cycle within which the adverse event was observed. Some patients/subjects may undergo multiple treatment cycles, such that two or more adverse events may be observed on the same day in cycle, but actually be observed on different dates, because they occur in different treatment cycles.

body_system.name: body_system
body_system.description: Major organ system or physiological characteristic assessed during the examination of the patient/subject/donor during a follow-up visit. Observations are reported independently on each organ system or physiological characteristic.

pe_finding.name: pe_finding
pe_finding.description: Indication as to the normal versus abnormal function of the major organ system or physiological characteristic assessed.

pe_comment.name: pe_comment
pe_comment.description: Narrative comment describing any notable observations concerning any given major organ system or physiological status assessed.

publication_title.name: publication_title
publication_title.description:
The full title of the publication stated exactly as it appears on the published work.
This property is used as the key via which to identify the correct records during data updates.

authorship.name: authorship
authorship.description: A list of authors for the cited work. More specifically, for publications with no more than three authors, authorship quoted in full; for publications with more than three authors, authorship abbreviated to first author et al.

year_of_publication.name: year_of_publication
year_of_publication.description: The year in which the cited work was published.

journal_citation.name: journal_citation
journal_citation.description: The name of the journal in which the cited work was published, inclusive of the citation itself in terms of journal volume number, part number where applicable, and page numbers.

digital_object_id.name: digital_object_id
digital_object_id.description: Where applicable, the digital object identifier for the cited work, by which it can be permanently identified, and linked to via the internet.

pubmed_id.name: pubmed_id
pubmed_id.description: Where applicable, the unique numerical identifier assigned to the cited work by PubMed, by which it can be linked to via the internet.

date_of_vital_signs.name: date_of_vital_signs
date_of_vital_signs.description: The date upon which the vital signs evaluation in question was conducted.

body_temperature.name: body_temperature
body_temperature.description: The temperature of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation.

body_temperature_original.name: body_temperature
body_temperature_original.description: The temperature of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation.

pulse.name: pulse
pulse.description: The heart rate of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, measured in beats per minute.

pulse_original.name: pulse
pulse_original.description: The heart rate of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, measured in beats per minute.

respiration_rate.name: respiration_rate
respiration_rate.description: The rate of respiration of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, measured in the number of breaths taken per minute.

respiration_rate_original.name: respiration_rate
respiration_rate_original.description: The rate of respiration of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, measured in the number of breaths taken per minute.

respiration_pattern.name: respiration_pattern
respiration_pattern.description: An indication as to the normality of the breathing pattern of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation.

systolic_bp.name: systolic_bp
systolic_bp.description: The systolic blood pressure of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, measured in mm of mercury.

systolic_bp_original.name: systolic_bp
systolic_bp_original.description: The systolic blood pressure of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, measured in mm of mercury.

pulse_ox.name: pulse_ox
pulse_ox.description: The level of oxygen saturation in the blood of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, expressed in terms of the percentage saturation.

pulse_ox_original.name: pulse_ox
pulse_ox_original.description: The level of oxygen saturation in the blood of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, expressed in terms of the percentage saturation.

patient_weight.name: patient_weight
patient_weight.description: The weight of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, measured in kilograms.

patient_weight_original.name: patient_weight
patient_weight_original.description: The weight of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, measured in kilograms.

body_surface_area.name: body_surface_area
body_surface_area.description: The body surface area of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, expressed in square meters.

body_surface_area_original.name: body_surface_area
body_surface_area_original.description: The body surface area of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation, expressed in square meters.

modified_ecog.name: modified_ecog
modified_ecog.description: The Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of the patient/subject/donor at the time of the vital signs evaluation. The value of this metric indicates the overall function of the patient/subject/donor and his/her ability to tolerate therapy.

ecg.name: ecg
ecg.description: Indication as to the normality of the electrocardiogram conducted during the vital signs evaluation.

day_in_cycle.name: day_in_cycle
day_in_cycle.description: Numerically, the day in the treatment cycle upon which any given adverse event was first observed, where Day 1 is the first day of the treatment cycle within which the adverse event was observed. Some patients/subjects may undergo multiple treatment cycles, such that two or more adverse events may be observed on the same day in cycle, but actually be observed on different dates, because they occur in different treatment cycles.

date_of_onset.name: date_of_onset
date_of_onset.description: The date upon which any given adverse event was first observed.

existing_adverse_event.name: existing_adverse_event
existing_adverse_event.description: An indication as to whether any given adverse event occurred prior to the enrollment of a patient/subject into the clinical trial in question, and/or was ongoing at the time of trial enrollment.

date_of_resolution.name: date_of_resolution
date_of_resolution.description: The date upon which any given adverse event resolved. If an adverse event was ongong at the time of death, the date of death should be used as the value date_of_resolution.

ongoing_adverse_event.name: ongoing_adverse_event
ongoing_adverse_event.description: An indication as to whether any given adverse event was ongoing as of the end of a treatment cycle, the end of the clinical trial itself, or the patient/subject being taken off study.

adverse_event_term.name: adverse_event_term
adverse_event_term.description: The specific controlled vocabulary term for any given adverse event, as defined by the Veterinary Comparative Oncology Group's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (VCOG-CTCAE).

adverse_event_description.name: adverse_event_description
adverse_event_description.description: A narrative description of any given adverse event which provides extra details as to its associated clinical, physical and behavioral observations, and/or mitigations for the adverse event.

adverse_event_grade.name: adverse_event_grade
adverse_event_grade.description: The grade of any given adverse event, reported as an enumerated value corresponding to one of the five distinct grades as defined by the Veterinary Comparative Oncology Group's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (VCOG-CTCAE).

adverse_event_grade_description.name: adverse_event_grade_description
adverse_event_grade_description.description: The grade of any given adverse event, reported in the form of a single descriptive term corresponding to one of the five enumerated grades as defined by the Veterinary Comparative Oncology Group's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (VCOG-CTCAE). Although numerical values for grade are standard terms for the reporting of adverse events, the narrative form of adverse event grades will be useful to users not already familiar with adverse event grading.

adverse_event_agent_name.name: adverse_event_agent_name
adverse_event_agent_name.description: The name of any investigational new drug being administered at the time of any given adverse event being observed.

adverse_event_agent_dose.name: adverse_event_agent_dose
adverse_event_agent_dose.description: The corresponding dose of any investigational new drug being administered at the time of any given adverse event being observed.

attribution_to_research.name: attribution_to_research
attribution_to_research.description: A qualitative indication as to whether any given adverse event is likely, possibly, probably or definitely caused by the clinical trial/research environment in general, or is unrelated to it.

attribution_to_ind.name: attribution_to_ind
attribution_to_ind.description: A qualitative indication as to whether any given adverse event is likely, possibly, probably or definitely caused by any investigational new drugs being administered as part of the clinical trial, or is unrelated to it.

attribution_to_disease.name: attribution_to_disease
attribution_to_disease.description: A qualitative indication as to whether any given adverse event is likely, possibly, probably or definitely caused by the disease for which the patient/subject is being treated, or is unrelated to it.

attribution_to_commercial.name: attribution_to_commercial
attribution_to_commercial.description: A qualitative indication as to whether any given adverse event is likely, possibly, probably or definitely caused by a commercially-available, FDA-approved therapeutic agent, used within the confines of the clinical trial either for its FDA-approved indication or in an off-label manner, but not as the investigational new drug or part of the investigational new therapy, versus the adverse event in question being unrelated to it.

attribution_to_other.name: attribution_to_other
attribution_to_other.description: A qualitative indication as to whether any given adverse event is likely, possibly, probably or definitely caused by some other factor(s), as described by the other_attribution_description property, or is unrelated to such other factors.

other_attribution_description.name: other_attribution_description
other_attribution_description.description: A description of any other factor or factors to which any given adverse event has been attributed. Where an adverse event is attributed to factors other than the standard factors of research, disease, IND or commercial, a description of the other factor(s) to which the adverse event was attributed is required.

dose_limiting_toxicity.name: dose_limiting_toxicity
dose_limiting_toxicity.description: An indication as to whether any given adverse event observed during the clinical trial is indicative of the dose of the therapeutic agent under test being limiting in terms of its toxicity.

unexpected_adverse_event.name: unexpected_adverse_event
unexpected_adverse_event.description: An indication as to whether any given adverse event observed during the clinical trial is completely unanticipated and therefore considered novel.

lesion_number.name: lesion_number
lesion_number.description: An arbitrary numerical designation for each lesion subject to evaluation, by which that lesion can be unambiguously identified.

lesion_site.name: lesion_site
lesion_site.description: The overall anatomical location of the lesion being assessed in terms of the organ or organ system in which it is located. For example, lung, lymph node, etc.

lesion_description.name: lesion_description
lesion_description.description: Additional detail as to the specific location of the lesion subject to evaluation. For example, in the case of a lymph node lesion, the specific lymph node in which the lesion is located.

date_of_evaluation.name: date_of_evaluation
date_of_evaluation.description: The date upon which the extent of disease evaluation was conducted.

measured_how.name: measured_how
measured_how.description: The method by which the size of any given lesion was determined.

longest_measurement.name: longest_measurement
longest_measurement.description: The longest dimension of the lesion subject to evaluation, as measured in (units TBD)

longest_measurement_original.name: longest_measurement
longest_measurement_original.description: The longest dimension of the lesion subject to evaluation, as measured in (units TBD)

evaluation_number.name: evaluation_number
evaluation_number.description: The number of the evaluation durinhg which any given lesion was examined, with evaluations numbered according to their chronological order.

evaluation_code.name: evaluation_code
evaluation_code.description: An indication as to the status of any given lesion being evaluated, in terms of the evaluation establishing a baseline for the lesion, versus the lesion subject to evaluation being new, being stable in size, decreasing in size, increasing in size or having resolved.

physical_exam_changes.name: physical_exam_changes
physical_exam_changes.description: How described? Relative to data already stored in "physical_exam" node?
